availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph L. Gregory (McLean County farmer and prov govt conv rep)

body.p: McLean County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government member. Kentucky native. Married to Emily Gregory. Father of James Gregory, William Gregory, Mary E. Gregory, Thomas Gregory, Joseph A. Gregory, Elisha W. Gregory, Samuel E. Gregory, and Emily B. Gregory. Farmer in Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Muhlenberg County in 1850. Farmer in McLean County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in McLean County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Sub Division No. 2, p. 231B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Muhlenberg County, Sub Division No. 2, p. 127.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, Bremen, p. 124.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, p. 435B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, Calhoun Precinct, p. 197B.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
